conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapter 18 of the main campaign.
Haaaah!
There ain't much point in splitting into two teams when we got THIS many fiends!
More incoming over here, guys!
Aaah!
Zena!
Out of the way!
Let go of me!
Hey! Get your grabby paws off her or I'll—
Graaagh!
Blargh! Owww...
(Maaan, why do faeries have to be so tiny and weak and lame-o?)
(If I had my other form back, I could be kicking fiend booty like everybody else.)
I wanna actually HELP!
Huh?! What's—?!
Notte?!
That light... Is it happening again?!
Ohmigosh, I'm HUGE! Yaaaaay!
('Kay, so it may not be the grown-up me, but it'll do. Now lemme just break out the scary Notte voice aaaand...)
GET YOUR HANDS OFF HER, YOU JERKFIEND!
Oh man, I totally nailed that...
Thank you, Notte.
No problem! Now stand back, sister, 'cause Notte's large and in charge like a runaway barge!
Easy there, tiger! Ya won't do nobody no good if ya rush in all crazy and... Yeah, she ain't listenin'.
Take THIS! And THIS! And one'a THESE! And some'a THOSE!
Hey, no dodging! That's totally unfair! Oh, fine then. I'll just give you...THIIIIIS!
Yesss! Got 'em right in the kisser. ...Wait, huh?
GROOOARGH!
Guuuh?!
She's in the river!
NOOOOOTTE!
Nnngh... Where...? Oh, right. I got swept off by the stupid river.
(My adult form totally could have taken that stupid fiend.)
(What's the point of getting bigger if I still can't fight?)
Muh?! What's...?
GRRRRAAAGH!
Oh, come on! MORE fiends?!
Well, you're not so tough on your own, buster! I can take you on my...self?
Okay, so apparently my foot's caught in these tree roots. Super awkward. Time out for a sec.
Grrrr...
Hey! I called time out, you big cheater! ...HAAAALP! SOMEBODY HAAALP ME!
AWOOOOOOORGH!
Eeeeeeeeek!
Phew, that was a close one! Are you all right?
What...? Whoa, I'm saved...
What are you doing out here all alone? We faeries all know fiends prowl this area.
Wait. You're a faerie, too?
Geez, you must have really hit your head. Yes, I'm a faerie—and the name's Shirley, by the by.
...Notte.
Nice to meet you, Notte. Hold tight, I'll have those roots cleared in a jiff.
Oh man, thanks a million. I thought I was gonna be tied to that tree forever.
It's hard getting used to being big at first; I've definitely had my share of face-plants.
I'm guessing you're an early bloomer? You seem young to have hit maturity.
Honestly, I don't really know. I just sorta blew up all outta nowhere, so... Huh?
Wait, I'm tiny again! BOOOOO!
Um, that actually...shouldn't be possible. Our bodies aren't designed to return to that form until we've fully matured.
Dude, I'm ten times as confused as you. It feels like I've been growing and shrinking on rotation lately.
Growing and... Wait, like this?
Yes! EXACTLY like that!
I still don't understand; you seem far too young to have reached full maturity.
Wait, so do all faeries get horkin' huge?
Is that a serious question? ...Er, but yes. We all grow larger at a certain age.
Oh. Sorry if that was super obvious— I'm the only faerie I've ever known, so I never had anyone to gimme the dirty deets on everything.
Okay, how is THAT possible?
Woof! Long story. Pull up a stump and I'll tell you all about it...
...So you've been in the outside world since you were a baby? Well, it's little wonder you don't know about faeries.
All right, so when faeries first enter the mature phase of their lives, they grow in size. And once this phase ends, they shrink back down to normal.
It was long thought that a faerie can't grow large again once fully mature, but that ended up not to be true.
A secret technique was found that makes it possible—a technique called metamorphosis.
Oooo, that's sounds hardcore!
Can you teach it to me?! Metamorphosis, I mean.
I'm afraid it can only be used by faeries who have passed through their large phase and into full maturity.
Can't hurt to try though, right? C'mon, pleeease?
Well, I suppose there's no harm...
If there's even a CHANCE of it working, I wanna try. I'm sick of being useless!
I mean, I want to protect the people who matter most to me, you know?
*sigh* Well, as I said, there's no harm. However, don't get your hopes up.
You. Are. THE BEST!
I admit, you seem to be something of a unique case—but please remember that I promise nothing in terms of results.
That's totally fine by me, Shirls. I'll do whatever it takes!
First, focus on the flow of mana. Now picture it surrounding your body as you slowly release it...
Focusing... Foooocusing...
Shirls, this isn't working at all.
Look, this is a bit awkward for me to say, but your handling of mana is...bad. Extremely bad. I mean, it is BAAAAD.
You don't have the slightest bit of control over it, which means mastering metamorphosis is hopeless. Heck, you'd have better luck teaching a hog to—
Okay, okay, I get it! I suck at mana! Whoa... That's weird. I feel all...dizzy...
Are you all right?
I think you used too much mana. Let's call it a day, okay?
No, let's keep going. I can keep going.
You're not ready for this, Notte. Trust me, it will come when you're ready.
No! It has to be now or there's no point! Please, just one more try.
That's enough! You're in no condition to—
No! You don't understand! You CAN'T understand!
You don't know what it's like to want to help your friends more than ANYTHING and just be a big fat burden instead.
A burden?
Run, Shirley! And don't look back!
I wanna fight for the people I love, okay?
I suppose that's not the kind of thing I can reasonably ask you to wait on...
Er, Shirls?
I understand how you feel, Notte. Painfully well, in fact.
In fact, I set out to learn metamorphosis for the very same reason.
For seriously?!
I mastered it in order to aid my friends.
A tiny faerie can't do much to fight back against the larger races, after all.
I lost someone once because of that— someone important—and I was furious at myself more than anyone.
I'm so sorry. That sucks.
Until now, it's been considered taboo among faeries to return to a larger size after reaching full maturity.
But why should that be if staying small means being powerless to help our own?
A number of us rejected that old thinking, which is how metamorphosis was developed.
Once I'd mastered it, I started patrolling the woods around the faerie kingdom to make sure tragedy never struck again.
Wait, so when you found me...?
Yep! I was doing my rounds. And just in time for you, might I add.
In any case, my point is that I completely understand your frustration.
I don't want you to go through what I did, so let's try to think up a better way to teach you metamorphosis.
Thanks, Shirls!
All right, let's see... You said you grew up not knowing the Faerie Kingdom, yes?
Right. I've been on the outside since I was just a wee little potato.
That's definitely unusual—as is this business of your growing before you've reached maturity.
I hope there isn't some sort of untoward explanation for all of this...
Huh? Like what?
Er, sorry. Just thinking out loud here. Still, that WOULD explain the lack of knowledge and complete inability to control mana...
What do you know about faeries, Notte?
Uh... Well, I guess we're supposed to be distant relatives to the dragons?
So basically nothing. Hmm...
All right! Here and now, we're enrolling you in Faerie 101! This'll be intense, so get your thinking cap screwed on tight.
Hit me with all you got, teach!
Focus on the mana... Fooocus...
Right, just like that. Give yourself over to the mana's natural flow.
Oh man, my body feels weirdly...hot?
Excellent! That's a really good sign! Now don't be frightened—let it infuse your entire body, then release it all at once.
Oh my gosh... Notte, you did it!
I did it! I did it! Now I can...
...Buh?
You've made amazing progress, Notte! Now you... Hmm? What's wrong?
No, no, NO! I wanted to become the GROWN-UP version of me!
Er, what do you mean?
Okay, one more time! Let's do this again!
I refuse to give up now!
One more time.
Okay, one more time.
Okay, ONE more time!
Two hundred and ninth time's the charm!
WHYYYYYYYY?!
Why are you so upset, Notte? It's frankly amazing you've learned to shift between your large and small forms so quickly.
I'd say you've just about mastered the technique at this point.
But that's not good enough! It has to be my grown-up form.
Notte, are you really sure that...happened? Maybe you just dreamed it.
No, it was real. I'm sure of it.
Well, let's chat more about this at dinner. It'll be dark soon, so we need to wrap up training today—and this time, I mean it.
Whoa, is it already that late?
Here, have some honeyed violet. You need something sweet to refuel.
Mmm, this smells outta this world...
Man, I got so caught up in training that I completely lost track of time. I hope my pals aren't crazy worried about me...
Well, you shouldn't try to head home now; you've used a lot of mana, so you'd be lucky not to pass out and become lunch for a hungry fiend.
I know you're eager to rejoin your friends, but rest for now and you can set out first thing tomorrow. Is that okay?
Actually, I want to keep training here. I need to learn how to get back to my adult form as quickly as possible.
You're really serious about this adult version of yourself.
...You believe me, right?
I admit, it's pretty fantastical; I did a lot of research during my metamorphoses training and I never heard of anything even resembling that.
But I ALSO can't imagine you'd be working this hard just to prop up a lie, so I'm willing to keep helping you out.
Thanks, Shirls.
Several days of intense training later...
Dude, this suuuucks! No matter how many times I try it, I can't make it work!
Hmm, you've gotten very good at controlling the size of your body...
And the fact you've done it once before means you must have the right type and quantity of mana inside you...
There's not much else I can think of that it might be, except...
Ooo! Except what?!
I wasn't going to mention it because I didn't think you were going to need it, but a faerie's power is...
NOTTE! Thank goodness!
Ah! Euden!
I can't believe the current carried you all the way down here! Are you all right?
Yeah, I'm great! Er, but sorry for making everybody all worried and junk.
I just wanted to be useful as soon as I could, so I've been training here!
Training, is it? Hmm... Well, anyway, maybe you can introduce me to your faerie friend here?
Oh, right! Sorry, this is Shirley! She totally saved my cracklins earlier.
She's got the power to change her size whenever she wants, and she's trying to teach me how to do the same thing.
That sounds pretty impressive, Shirley. And thank you for aiding my frie—
No, don't worry yourself about me. Your training here is done, Notte.
Huh? Shirley, what do you—
Your friend's here to take you home, right?
Well yeah, but... I mean, I was sorta hoping to learn more from you.
Yes, well, I just remembered an important errand I have been neglecting, so our parting comes at a good time.
Oh. Er, I mean... Yeah, okay. Sure. Didn't know you were so busy.
So what about tomorrow, then?! Would you mind teaching me tomorrow?
...If I feel like it.
Shirls... What did I do...?
...Is this true, Shirley?
I saw it with my own two eyes. I'd have never guessed they were on Faerie Kingdom soil otherwise.
It's like a dream—and not a good one. So how do you want to proceed?
I have something in mind for tomorrow...
I guess Shirley didn't feel like coming.
I thought she liked helping me train, but maybe she thought I was just a big pain in the grass the whole time.
Sorry to keep you waiting, Notte.
Shirls! You came! You really came!
Yes—and I'm sorry for disappearing so suddenly yesterday.
No, I should be the one to apologize! Did your errand go okay?
Yes, it was fine. But listen, Notte. Is the human who arrived here yesterday the one you are hoping to protect?
Yup! He's just about my best bud in the whole world!
I see. In that case, let's train extra hard today for his sake.
Heck yeah!
Euden's Encampment
Break out the cake and streamers and trombones, 'cause Notte is BACK!
It's good to see you again, Notte. How'd the training go?
Oh, I struck out again like always—but Shirls said she'll work with me again tomorrow!
It sounds like you've made a lovely new friend, Notte.
Yeah, she's pretty awesome.
That's great to he... Oh, wow. I've never seen butterflies like that before.
Neither have I. They're...beautiful. I wonder if they're native to the Faerie Kingdom?
Wha?! Guys, what's going on?!
They all fell asleep—which is super weird, because there's no way I'm THAT boring.
It is because of the lullaflies which are found here in the outskirts of the kingdom. Their scales put all but the fae to sleep.
Now all that remains is to ensure they never awaken. A simple mission, really.
Shirls? What's going on?!
Shirley, what's going on? What are you doing here?
I followed you, together with the lullaflies.
I'm here to kill him.
WHAT THE WHAT?!
That human is a threat to the kingdom.
Though I suppose you wouldn't understand, having been away your whole life.
He's not a THREAT! He's the nicest—
A human? NICE? Madness!
If your dear humans are so ＂nice,＂ then why was my sister butchered?!
What...?
I will never be free of that terrible day; I see it every time I close my eyes.
I'd just returned to my small size and was preparing to go home to the Faerie Kingdom.
But I was duped by humans and nearly had my wings snapped, until my older sister saved me.
...By being taken in my place.
Hold on! I'm coming!
Run, Shirley! And don't look back!
I ran to the kingdom for help, but by the time they made it back, she was gone. All that remained were her wings.
That is so horrible...
So I mastered the hidden technique to ensure the same fate never befell any others of my people.
Humans are feral beasts, yet our fool of a king abetted them—and the putrid fruit of his sin is that man there!
If I'm supposed to be following that part, you're gonna be real disappointed.
You need not understand. Suffice it to say your friend there is a thing which cannot be suffered to exist in this world.
Don't say that about him!
Imagine my shock when the one you sought to protect was him, of all people!
Though you made finding him a simple task, for which you have my thanks.
Now stand aside. I've no wish to hurt you.
No.
*sigh*...Of course that would be your answer.
Very well. If we must do this the hard way, I am prepared to see it through.
Well, you better strap on the battle gear, toots, 'cause I'm not backing down!
I won't hold back, Notte. ...Haaaah!
Yaaaaaaah!
AUGH!
Is that really your best? That blow carried all the weight of a mosquito.
I wish YOU'D make like a mosquito and buzz off already! Haaaah!
Too slow!
Ugh! Dangit!
It is a cruel reality to realize one's strength is tied directly to their size.
That fact cost me my sister...
And today, it means your friend will die.
Nnngh...
(I've gotta do something or all my friends are gonna be toast!)
(My grown-up form is the only answer...)
Okay, Notte... Focus that mana...
I do hope you're not fool enough to think I'll just stand politely to the side and wait while you attempt to change forms.
Aaaugh!
You tried and failed, tried and failed... Hundreds of times you tried and failed! You are a tenacious thing, if nothing else.
This is my final warning, Notte: Walk away from these human wretches. Make a new home in the Faerie Kingdom.
We faeries live in different worlds, experience time in different ways, and hold a different set of values.
We are happiest among our own. You will come to know this in time.
I...I can't...
Okay, sure. Maybe it IS best for faeries to live with other faeries...
But I want to be here with these people— even if it means fighting my own kind!
That's disappointing, Notte; I had hoped we might become fast friends.
Still, it's best for you to sleep now; I don't wish you to see your friends die.
NOOOOOOOOOO!
(I was useless to the very end...)
(I hate this... Why was I born so weak?)
(I'm so sorry, everybody...)
Zethia! Notte! What are you doing here? I told you to wait at the castle!
You shouldn't try to do this alone. Let us help you!
Besides, we both know the only reason you benched us is so we could come swooping in to save the day!
I was TRYING to protect you! You both know these woods are home to all manner of terrible fiends!
Ugh! Protect us from what? That dark prison of death we just busted you out of?
She's right, Brother. We agreed on this. No matter how trying the ordeal, the three of us must face it together.
You're right. I was overconfident. And there's no denying I could use the help. Thank you, both of you. Now let's move out—our goal is just ahead.
(Zethia and I followed him that day so we could keep our promise...)
(We promised that no matter how tough things got, we'd always face it together.)
(I didn't break my promise then, and I'm not gonna do it now!)
And since I'm the only one still upright, that means I have to protect everyone!
It's so bright! What's going on?!
I won't let you hurt them, Shirley.
You've actually taken on an adult form... Who ARE you, Notte?!
...No. It doesn't matter who you are. What I must do here remains unchanged!
(It's just like before—I feel crazy strength bubbling up inside me.)
(Well, it'll have to be enough, because no friend of mine is dying today!)
I won't let anyone get away with trying to hurt the people I love. Not even you!
Haaaaah!
YAAAAAAH!
(Such potent mana—yet she was barely able to CONTROL mana just days ago!)
I'm gonna save everybody!
(I...I can't match her!)
Aaaaaugh!
Nnngh... You have bested me...
Tell me how to wake my friends up before I totally go ham on you!
The sleep of the lullaflies is temporary. Your friends will wake in time.
But why, Notte? Why do you go so far for the sake of that human?
He's a danger—his mere EXISTENCE is a threat. And if you stay at his side, that danger will fall on you.
Lady, my staying safe is literally the least of my concerns.
We're friends. That's the end of it.
And we made a promise that no matter the ordeal, we'd face it together.
So I'm gonna protect him. I'll make sure he never turns into the monster you seem to think he is!
Ah. Now I understand how you were able to take on that form.
Wait, you do? How?!
You're asking advice of a person you just bested in battle? Heh.
Well, I may as well tell you what I didn't get the chance to tell you before. One final lesson, if you will.
Before? ...Ah!
There's not much else I can think of that it might be, except...
Ooo! Except what?!
I wasn't going to mention it because I didn't think you were going to need it, but a faerie's power is...
A faerie's power is tied to the strength of their own heart.
The stronger the feelings, the stronger the technique they're able to wield.
From the first moment I met you, I could tell you already had such feelings, so didn't think it worth mentioning.
But I see now it was hardly scratching the surface. I greatly underestimated you.
Er, so why teach me this now?
To be blunt. I don't see us being friends after all this. I don't understand you, and I can't abide letting that human live.
But seeing you desperate to protect the ones you care about? That I understand.
It's like I'm looking at my past self. And while I don't agree with your choices, I can't turn my back either.
Aw, Shirls...
Don't forget what you felt in that moment; it is the key to controlling the technique.
I understand—and thanks.
Guys, look! Check me out! I learned how to change size at will!
What an accomplishment, Notte!
Ya picked that up in the time it took us to have a nap?
Yeah, turns out I'm kind of a genius.
And now I can fight with you guys!
Ha ha! We'll rest easy knowing Notte the mighty warrior has our backs.
He's a danger—his mere EXISTENCE is a threat. And if you stay at his side, that danger will fall on you.
(What did she mean by that?)
Er, do I have something on my face, Notte? Luca didn't draw on me while I was asleep again, did he?
Nope! You're good. Just spacing out.
But yeah, leave it to me, 'cause I'll keep everybody safe no matter what!
(No matter what the future holds, it doesn't change my job here.)
(I'll have the strength to fight now...)
Whatever happens, we'll tackle it as a team—and that's a Notte promise!
